subclassFeature.name: Marksman
entries: Unlike many rogues you've fine-tuned your skills with all manner of ranged weaponry, able to hit targets with deadly ease. You excel at striking from a distance, carefully lining up the perfect shot to fell foes in short order, and halting enemies in their tracks using your vigilant reactions, with the most skilled of your sort able to lay down a barrage of fire effortlessly.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Aim
entries: Starting at 3rd level you've honed a killer's aim, staying still to line up the perfect shot. As a bonus action, you give yourself advantage on your next ranged attack roll on the current turn, which scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.
At 13th level you can use this bonus action if you have moved no more than half your movement speed during this turn.
At 17th level your next attack after using your {@subclassFeature Deadly Aim|Rogue|PHB|Marksman|FFMarksman|3|FFMarksman} bonus action scores a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Also at 3rd level you gain proficiency with {@item light crossbow|PHB|light crossbows}, {@item longbow|PHB|longbows} and {@item heavy crossbow|PHB|heavy crossbows}.
Additionally if your Dungeon Master uses rules for firearms, you are proficient with them too.

subclassFeature.name: Talented Tinker
entries: {@i 3rd-level marksman rogue {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}

If your DM is using the rules for firearms included in {@i Armour, Items and Weapons Galore!} then at 3rd level you also become skilled in quickly repairing firearms. You gain proficiency in {@item tinker's tools|PHB} and can repair a {@itemProperty FFIGBR|FFItemsGalore|broken} firearm as a bonus action instead of an action.

subclassFeature.name: Overwatch
entries: Starting at 9th level you're able to hold a deadly vigil, ready to halt enemies in their tracks. As an action, you draw a line 15 feet wide and 150 feet long out from yourself in a direction you choose and your speed becomes 0 until the end of your turn.

Once per turn, when a creature you can see willingly moves into or within the area, you can make one ranged weapon attack against them provided they are within your weapon's range. On a hit, the target's speed is also reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.
Attacks made as part of this action ignore the loading quality of ranged weapons with which you are proficient.

This feature lasts until the start of your next turn and ends early if you move 5 feet or more, are {@condition incapacitated}, or when you have made a number of attacks equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1).
You can use this feature three times and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master Marksman
entries: Starting at 13th level, your shooting skills have become exceptional. When you make an attack roll with a ranged weapon, you can choose to re-roll one of the dice once, but must use the new result. You can choose to use this feature after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Aim Improvement
entries: At 13th level you can use this bonus action if you have moved no more than half your movement speed during this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Fire
entries: At 17th level you're able to lay down a withering hail of fire. You ignore the loading quality of ranged weapons with which you are proficient.

Additionally on your turn, when you score a critical hit with a ranged weapon you can make another attack with the same weapon against the same target. An extra attack made with this feature that scores a critical hit will also generate another attack, up to a limit equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: A note on Rapid Fire
entries: Additionally if your DM is using the rules for firearms included in Armour, Items and Weapons Galore! then at 17th level you also ignore the "{@itemProperty FFIGRD|FFItemsGalore|reload}" property of firearms with which you are proficient, being able to reload them with no action required.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Aim Improvement
entries: At 17th level your next attack after using your Deadly Aim bonus action scores a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.
